verse.roman:
krośantaṁ kṛṣṇa rāmeti
vilokya sva-parigraham
yathā gā dasyunā grastā
bhrātarāv anvadhāvatām

synonyms: krośantam—crying out; kṛṣṇa rāma iti—"Kṛṣṇa! Rāma!"; vilokya—seeing; sva-parigraham—Their devotees; yathā—just as; gāḥ—cows; dasyunā—by a thief; grastāḥ—seized; bhrātarau—the two brothers; anvadhāvatām—ran after.
translation: Hearing Their devotees crying out "Kṛṣṇa! Rāma!" and seeing that they were just like cows being stolen by a thief, Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma began to run after the demon.
